title: Q:《法律系知識産權》論文 Intellectual property law dissertation.

replies.msg:
Hi I think it's better to type English as it would be more convenient. I m doing my master degree dissertation right now, can i am so confused, I hope anyone who is studying law, JD LLB LLM can give my some advices. 12000 words.

My topic:
The copyright system is unable to effectively respond to challenges posed by digitalisation and the internet.

Topic area: intellectual property right law

1. I think my topic is too board, obviously. And I have to narrow it down, I would be comparing the situation of HK v UK (+ v Macao), based on Article 23.

2. I m thinking should I use comparative methodology. Or it's just better to use UK as reference, for recommendation.

3. I am thinking my target audience. Student, teens or citizens? There is a lot of news or surveys mainly about online copyright infringement of teenagers.

4. Which area I should focus, would be more beneficial? File uploading, photos or movie sharing, pirates, stealing online games weapon/ money, attack website/ hackers.... I have to narrow it down.

These are the things I m struggling.
Please advice. Many thanks.

What is the Article 23 you are referring to? Do you mean the copyright amendment bill a few years ago?

You can opt for depth or breadth if you are making comparisons between countries and HK. Unless you know UK's law really well, I wouldn't suggest you to narrow your scope to UK's law only.

If your thesis is on the Internet, you should write on the Internet as a whole. If you are only discussing certain areas/activities only, people might suspect you are cherry picking information to support your thesis.

quote.msg:

If your thesis is on the Internet, you should write on the Internet as a whole. If you are only discussing certain areas/activities only, people might suspect you are cherry picking information to support your thesis.

replies.msg: Then you need to revise your thesis. Narrow down your focus. Don't make sweeping statements you can't prove.

how does a comparative analysis prove or disprove your thesis.

From how i read your thesis, i.e. the copyright system is unable to effectively respond to challenges posed by digitalisation and the internet, i expect to see challenges posed by the digitalization and the internet, preferably a specific but widely seen scenario and explain how the law regulates it or the lack thereof.


A comparison of the hk infringment law vs uk vs macau is not at all helpful unless you have yourself a concrete scenario.

Let say if you want to talk about "secondary creations", then
- talk about what the scenario is and how it is trending or has been a problem
- how the current law attacks this issue and/or the lack thereof
- how the bill and/or proposed legislation attack this issue and/or the lack thereof
- comparatively, how other jurisdictions attack this problem

Then, you have yourself a logical flow of idea that you can prove and/or disprove.

Simple comparative analysis does not stem from your current thesis.

(of course, unless you change your thesis to how HK copyright law trails behind UK copyright law. Then that is a totally different paper you are writing.)


Side note, my thesis was along the same time of the logical flow above but on entirely different issue than copyright.


Hope this helps

You can't start planning your dissertation by your own FF idea
--> The copyright system is unable to effectively respond to challenges posed by digitalisation and the internet.

Be open-minded first.

First do your research. How is the copyright law in HK right now? How does it cope with HK's internet activities? What do most people in HK use internet for? Are many people infringing HK's copyright law? If not, is it a problem that needs to be solved? Have people who own copyrights complained? Are their complaints justified? Is it a copyright problem, or merely an enforcement problem? If changes are needed, are the proposed changes compatible with the constitutionally protected rights? Do the proposed changes conform to international standards? How would the proposed changes affect business and people's lives?

I am not even conversant in IP law btw. But I have written enough papers in law subjects to know how to structure one.
